skill.name: qiskit
skill.description: Comprehensive quantum computing toolkit for building, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Use when working with quantum algorithms, simulations, or quantum hardware including (1) Building quantum circuits with gates and measurements, (2) Running quantum algorithms (VQE, QAOA, Grover), (3) Transpiling/optimizing circuits for hardware, (4) Executing on IBM Quantum or other providers, (5) Quantum chemistry and materials science, (6) Quantum machine learning, (7) Visualizing circuits and results, or (8) Any quantum computing development task.
skill.summary: Comprehensive quantum computing toolkit for building, optimizing, and executing quantum circuits. Us...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential harvesting, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Content focuses on Qiskit usage and includes only instructional code and documentation links.

content.user_title: Build and run Qiskit quantum workflows
content.value_statement: Quantum circuit development can be complex across simulators and hardware. This skill provides clear guidance for Qiskit circuits, primitives, transpilation, and execution.
actual_capabilities: Explain Qiskit installation and Python environment setup
Show how to build circuits with gates, measurements, and parameters
Describe Sampler and Estimator primitives with examples
Guide transpilation and optimization level choices
Outline execution on simulators and IBM Quantum backends
Explain circuit and result visualization options
limitations: Requires local Qiskit installation to run any code
Hardware execution needs an IBM Quantum account and token
Does not execute circuits or validate results
Does not provide access to provider quotas or hardware availability

use_cases.title: Learn quantum circuits
use_cases.description: Build and visualize basic circuits and understand measurements with Qiskit.

use_cases.title: Prototype VQE workflows
use_cases.description: Set up primitives, transpilation, and execution patterns for variational algorithms.

use_cases.title: Prepare hardware runs
use_cases.description: Choose backends, optimize circuits, and manage jobs for IBM Quantum hardware.

prompt_templates.title: Install Qiskit
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide steps to install Qiskit with uv, create a venv, and verify the installation with a short import check.

prompt_templates.title: Build a Bell circuit
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a Qiskit example that creates a Bell state, measures both qubits, and runs on a local sampler with counts.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize for hardware
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to transpile a circuit for an IBM Quantum backend with optimization level 3 and why it helps.

prompt_templates.title: Run a VQE loop
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a VQE workflow using Estimator in a Session, including parameter binding and cost function evaluation.

output_examples.input: Explain how to run a Bell circuit locally and view results.
output: Install Qiskit and optional visualization extras
Create a two qubit circuit with H and CX, then measure
Run with StatevectorSampler and print counts
Use plot_histogram or circuit draw to visualize results

best_practices: Start with simulators before running on hardware
Transpile circuits for the target backend before execution
Use Sampler for bitstrings and Estimator for expectation values
anti_patterns: Skipping transpilation when targeting real devices
Submitting hardware jobs without checking backend status
Sharing API tokens in prompts or logs

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Qiskit versions?
faq.answer: It targets current Qiskit patterns and may need adjustments for older versions.

faq.question: What are the main limitations?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not execute code or access hardware on your behalf.

faq.question: Can it integrate with IBM Quantum Runtime?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes guidance for QiskitRuntimeService, Sessions, and primitives.

faq.question: Is my data or token accessed?
faq.answer: No, it does not read local files or transmit credentials.

faq.question: What if my code errors during setup?
faq.answer: Check Python version, reinstall Qiskit, and verify the environment activation.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic coding help?
faq.answer: It provides Qiskit specific workflows, primitives, and transpilation guidance.
